fields.summary: Variable in byte printed directly in mapreduce client

comments.body: Thanks [~lewuathe] for the patch! Can you remove the format changes in your patch since they are unrelated to this change?
[~haibochen] Thanks for checking! The format violates checkstyle but as you said it's unrelated. I updated.

[~kaisasak], thanks for the quick update! While looking at this description again, it does not seem clear to me what issue this jira is reporting.
Is the problem that the secret value should not be printed out? Or is it that the byte content is not printed out?  If it is the former,  printing is probably OK given that this is a test. If it is the latter, I think we should convert the byte array to String and print it out.

[~haibochen] Thanks for comment. I think the both case. Secret value is thought not to be printed initially. But anyway it's printed as byte[] value. We cannot see the secret value even if it's printed. So it should be printed as string if it needs to be printed.

Committed this to trunk, branch-2, and branch-2.8. Thanks all who contributed to this issue.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #11337 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/11337/])
MAPREDUCE-6753. Variable in byte printed directly in mapreduce client. (aajisaka: rev 19a1fc6373f0dea56e5845f19990d469428489bc)
* (edit) hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-jobclient/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/mapreduce/security/CredentialsTestJob.java
2.8.1 became a security release. Moving fix-version to 2.8.2 after the fact.
